name: Donair
description: Call it a donair, a gyro or a shawarma, they’re all versions of a sandwich with thinly sliced meat wrapped up in a warm pita. And here we've got a rainbow of crispy, crunchy veggies, adding a burst of colour and flavour to every bite. Save a whopping 45 minutes by cooking the meat in the microwave—innovative cooking hacks for the win!

ingredients.name: East Coast Donair Sauce or Dillicious Tzatziki
head romaine or leafy green lettuce

preparation:
Microwave:

  1. In large bowl, combine seasoning with beef and water until well blended.
  2. Press into Rectangular Steamer. Cover and microwave on high for 13 min. 
  3. To serve, thinly slice meat. Serve on pita with East Coast Donair Sauce or Dillicious Tzatziki (if using), tomatoes, cucumber, red onion, and lettuce.

Oven:

  1. Preheat oven to 375° F. 
  2. In large bowl, combine seasoning with beef and water until well blended.
  3. Press into 9" x 5" loaf pan. Bake in preheated oven for 1 hour.
  4. To serve, thinly slice meat. Serve on pita with East Coast Donair Sauce or Dillicious Tzatziki (if using), tomatoes, cucumber, red onion, and lettuce.
tips: Refrigerate loaf up to 3 days. Slice, then pan fry until crispy.
perfectlyBalanceYourPlate: Serve with 2 cups mixed greens with 2 tbsp Epicure Salad Dressing, your choice.
